channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024020968
item.description:
Report X-2024020968

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-07
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET IN UNLOAD TRAILER. PRODUCT GOT ON ONE EMPLOYEE; THEY FLUSHED SKIN WITH COLD WATER. UPON INSPECTION, ONE BOTTLE HAD LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAP AND SOILED OTHER BOTTLE. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAP AND SOILED OTHER BOTTLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. AFFECTED EMPLOYEE FLUSHED SKIN WITH COLD WATER.

item.title: Report X-2024020581
item.description:
Report X-2024020581

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON A CART WITH LIQUID LEAKING FROM THE BOTTOM. THE LIQUID LEAKED ON THE CART/PACKAGES AND DRIPPED OVER ONTO THE FLOOR. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DESCISION TREE/CORROSIVE RESPONSE, CONTAINMENT AND REMOVAL RESPONDER RETURNED TO THE DMP AREA.

item.title: Report X-2024021042
item.description:
Report X-2024021042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: CHAMPAIGN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE FOUND WET. UPON INSPECTION, BATTERY HAD LEAKED ACID. IT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING FROM DEFECTIVE SEAMS; NO OBVIOUS ABRASION DAMAGE. PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED. UNDECLARED LEAD-ACID BATTERY. DescribePack: BATTERY WAS LEAKING ACID. IT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING FROM DEFECTIVE SEAMS; NO OBVIOUS ABRASION DAMAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE CONTAINED; SPILLAGE ABSORBED.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS PICKED UP BY DRIVER (PLASTIC JUG IN A CARDBOARD OVERPACK). AS UNLOADER WAS PREPARING TO UNLOAD THEY NOTICED STRONG SMELL AND SAW BOX LEAKING. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND PROCESSED ALL REMAINING PRODUCT THROUGH DMP. DURING INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED LID ON THE PLASTIC JUG WAS LOOSE.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found when unloading a van. Package was wet and leaking. Package was removed from operation area and taken to Hazmat Cage for processing. Any spill was cleaned up and materials used were brought to Hazmat cage. DescribePack: loose caps and seals on inner bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as package was discovered leaking it was removed from the area and taken to Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020408
item.description:
Report X-2024020408

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-11
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet on bank 3 after being tossed off the belt by the tagger. Package had Flammable Liquid labeling. Package was put in a plastic bag and taken to the HazMat Cage in order to isolate it from the rest of the employees. The fan was turned on in the HazMat cage to vent the odor. Package was researched and was determined to be a Flammable Liquid HazMat. DescribePack: 1 of the 6 glass bottles inside had shattered, this caused a leak of Hazardous Materials DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat cage for isolation and processing.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found leaking after it placed on route. DescribePack: the cap was loose and there was a small crack found on the opening allowing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package was removed from the area and absorbent material was used for clean up.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed flammable liquid package was discovered wet. Further inspection of the package confirmed that the 1 liter glass bottle inside was shattered during transit DescribePack: Glass bottle packaged inside a plastic bag and absorbent pads wrapped around it, but the glass bottle shattered and caused internal release of the isopropanol product inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Evaporated/ Contained inside plastic bag

item.title: Report X-2024020223
item.description:
Report X-2024020223

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: MARION
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer 811023 from NTSO-633 arrived and was opened, before the trailer was completely open it was apparent there had been a major spill, when the trailer as completely opened the culprit of the leak fell onto the station floor. The trailer had a total of 4 corrosive HAZMATSs loaded on it, none of them were braced and there was no load net on the trailer. DescribePack: The point of failure was the cap, contents seeped through due to improper bracing leading to the package falling over DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was no longer releasing contents when the trailer was opened, the 13 other packages affected be the release absorbed the spill.

  • Description: (1) 55 gallon metal drum of Frosto, which was punctured by a forklift, causing approximately 1 gallon to release. No Drains, Soils, or waterway were impacted.
